change.item: PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::George L. Usher Papers)//EN" "usher.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

titlepage.titleproper: Inventory of the George L. Usher Papers, 1909-1918
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1998 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Depicts World War I German aircraft, American aircraft in 1909, and scenes of Vera Cruz in 1914. Includes aerial reconnaissance views of World War I military activity in France

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], George L. Usher Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1969.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: 135th Squadron in France, World War I
Chief of Personnel of the Air Force
Commander, Moffett Field, Mountain View, California
Deputy Commander of the 13th Air Force in the South Pacific

did.unittitle: Photographs depicting World War I German aircraft; American aircraft in 1909, including photographs of Orville Wright and Kirkland, one of the first air force pilots; scenes of Vera Cruz, Mexico, in 1914 during the American occupation. Includes aerial reconnaissance views of World War I military action in France
